Improve this resume bullet:
""Hi!We are on the lookout for a dedicated Dispute Resolution Manager who is passionate about resolving conflicts and ensuring customer satisfaction. This role is crucial for maintaining the integrity of our customer relationships and fostering a positive environment where disputes are handled with efficiency, empathy, and professionalism.Responsibilities:Managing and resolving customer disputes in a timely and effective manner.Overseeing dispute resolution processes, including documentation and follow-ups.Communicating with customers via email to address concerns, provide updates, and resolve conflicts.Enhancing our dispute resolution framework and contributing to the continuous improvement of our support processes.Ensuring prompt response to all dispute inquiries, adhering to our goal of a 24-hour response time.Upholding the highest level of professionalism and discretion in all interactions.KNOWLEDGE OF THESE PLATFORMS:Klarna (disputes)Paypal (disputes)Shopify (chargebacks)Re-amaze (support help desk)Shopify (eCommerce platform)Discord (communication channel)DeepL (for translation)We will provide you with:Comprehensive video training.Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) to guide your work.Direct access to the Lead Customer Support for any questions or guidance.Applicant needs to:Possess fluent English skills, both written and verbal.Have a minimum of 2 years of experience in dispute resolution or a related field.Be available for weekly team calls.Exhibit strong organizational skills, motivation, and a keen interest in professional growth and development.Be ready to join our team immediately.Ideally, we're looking for someone with experience in customer support or dispute resolution who is genuinely interested in making a positive impact on customer relations. We value consistency and accuracy in communication and expect our team members to avoid sending repetitive or off-topic responses to our customers. When you read through this, comment the word strawberry for your job application.Please share your relevant experience and explain why you believe you are the ideal candidate for this role.We look forward to your application.Thank you.Kind regards,KamilCEO CustomloveHourly Range: $4.00-$8.00Posted On: February 16, 2024 15:55 UTCCategory: Email, Phone & Chat SupportSkills:Shopify, PayPalSkills: Shopify, PayPalCountry: Netherlands""

Improve this resume bullet:
""Following are details of the project.1....As a Deputy Project Manager, you are tasked to construct a two-story Villa in Islamabad in a year. Your Project Manager has tasked you to create a work breakdown of the activities for the construction of the two-story villa over 11000 square feet of land. You are directed to create a critical Path using the PERT Method while projecting the current market cost of each activity.2....You are halfway through the construction of the Villa, your foundation work has been completed, whereas the incurred cost increased as compared to the Plan Value by 10% in each activity. You are at the completion stage of the ground floor with an estimated increase in the cost of each activity by 7% as compared to the original cost. You are directed by your Project Manager to analyze the project and provide a report on the Cost Performance Index (CPI), Schedule Performance Index, Cost Variance and Schedule Variance. As of today, the project time period is five months and 13 days.3...The project is not moving as per the Planned Value. Your Project Manager has directed you to Crash the Project completely. Each activity of the foundation has a crash cost estimated to be 20 % of its normal cost. The First and Second Floor Crash Costs are estimated to be 10% and 5% respectively. The Overhead Cost of the Project is 100,000 Rs/Day. Your Object is to reduce the Cost of the Project to minimize the losses earlier and finish the Project either on time or beforeBudget: $7Posted On: February 23, 2024 09:24 UTCCategory: Digital Project ManagementSkills:Project Scheduling, Time Management, Budget Management, Project Management, Cost Control, Primavera P6, Scheduling, Project Workflows, Project PlansSkills: Project Scheduling, Time Management, Budget Management, Project Management, Cost Control, Primavera P6, Scheduling, Project Workflows, Project PlansCountry: Pakistan""

Improve this resume bullet:
""You need to develop and implement a set of classes that represent the different elements that appear in a game. You are not developing the complete game, just the setting up, specific snapshots, and display of the game. You are required to write a 'level' editor for a simple game called MysteryWorld. A level in MysteryWorld is a room made up from 10 x 10 grid. Each cell in the room is referred to by the row and column number (coordinate).Game Specifications• A room in MysteryWorld can be populated by two types of entities: inanimate and animate entities.• There are two kinds of inanimate entities: stones which are represented by 'S' and holes which are represented by an 'O'. Holes also have a depth in meters represented by a number between 0 and 20. Expectedly, inanimate do not move.• Each living entity has a measure of its health, represented using an integer value between 0 and 100 and all the living entities can move. There are three types of living entities: dragons represented by the symbol #, human beings represented by @; and monsters represented by a ' * ‘ character. Each human being has a name, the monsters have strength represented by a number between 0 and 5.• All the animate objects can move and their health is usually reduced when they move.• Animate entities wandering around the worldo Humans: The humans always move to the cell to on their right, provided that this cell is not occupied and that they are not at the edge of the room. Otherwise they move to unoccupied randomly chosen cell adjacent to their current position. Their health is reduced by one every time that they move.o A dragon moves to a cell that is randomly chosen from those cells that are unoccupied, and adjacent to its current position. The health of the dragon is very volatile and is reduced by a random number between 0 and 5 every time it moves.o Monsters: A monster moves as many cells as its strength at any direction (up, down, left or right) as long as the destination is free and the monster remains within the room. For instance, the monster in position (9,3) in with strength 5 can move to position (9,8) but it cannot move to (4,3) because the cell is occupied, the monster cannot move to any other cell because it will reach the end of the room. In the case that there are not possible movements, the monster will move to a random empty cell next to it. The health is reduced as many points as the strength. In the unlikely event that all the possible options are invalid, the entity will not move. Furthermore, the default movement of all the living entities is to a random adjacent cell. You will work only with the console application to test your implementation. Code needs to have at least 3 classes: 1. Entity class: This is an abstract class which will act as the parent (base) class to all the different entities (Holes, Stones, Humans…) of the game.2. Room class: This is the class that stores the positions of all the entities. It should ideally contain the Methods to add entities, display the room, display information etc.3. Main class: This is the main class that handles the game. The menu will be implemented here and you will need to add the call to the specific actions.Functional Requirements1) The program should be a console application. The user interacts with the program by typing instructions into the standard input, and the program gives output by writing to the standard output.When the program starts, it should display the initial state of the game, and a menu. The initial state of the game should contain 2 holes, 2 stones, 3 monsters, 3 humans, 2 dragons, placed randomly in the room, with the constraint that two entities cannot occupy the same position. In the initial state, the depth of the holes is a random number between 0 and 20, monsters will be allocated a random strength between 0 and 5 and the three humans will be: Harold, David and Clare. All the animate entities are 100% healthy.2) The initial menu should offer the following options:1. Display Room2. Move all the animated entities3. Display the entity state by coordinates4. Reset the room5. Finish3) If the user selects ‘1’ from the menu, the state of the game should be displayed as shown in Figure 14) If the user selects ‘2’ from the menu, all the living entities should be moved according to the rules specified earlier.5) If the user selects ‘3’ from the menu, they should be prompted to specify a row, and a column, and then the properties of the entity at that position (if there is one) should be displayed, the output might be as follows:Entity properties:Type: humanName: HaroldHealth: 47If there is no entity in that cell, then your program should output a suitable message.6) If the user selects ‘4’ from the menu, then the state of the board should be reinitialised, in the manner described in functional requirements.7) If the user selects ‘5’ from the menu, then the program should terminate.Budget: $50Posted On: February 19, 2024 12:44 UTCCategory: Video Game DevelopmentSkills:C++Skills: C++Country: United Kingdom""
